references.paper_title: Structured denoising diffusion models in discrete state-spaces
references.reason: This paper provides the foundation for applying diffusion models to discrete data, crucial for molecular graph generation.

references.paper_title: Diffusion models beat gans on image synthesis
references.reason: This is a seminal paper showing the effectiveness of diffusion models in image generation, which inspired the application to molecular graphs.
This foundational paper introduced the concept of denoising diffusion probabilistic models, which forms the basis of the Graph DiT model.

references.paper_title: Digress: Discrete denoising diffusion for graph generation
references.reason: This paper is a direct predecessor to the proposed Graph DiT, offering a baseline method for graph-based diffusion models.

references.paper_title: SCScore: synthetic complexity learned from a reaction corpus
references.reason: This work provides the synthetic accessibility score (SAS), a crucial property used in evaluating the generated molecules and guiding the model.
